name: Sauced: Hollandaise
description: Sometimes perceived as a difficult sauce, Hollandaise is actually pretty simple after following just a couple important directions. This creamy, rich, tangy sauce should come out right every time, ready to top Eggs Benedict or beautifully dress a plate of asparagus.
recipeIngredient: 10 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 1 tablespoon pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a medium saucepan with 1-inch of water and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to low.
Place egg yolks in a medium bowl and whisk until they lighten in color, about 1 minute.
Place bowl with eggs over saucepan with simmering water and whisk constantly until thickened and doubled volume, about 3 to 5 minutes.

Remove bowl from from saucepan with water and whisk in butter 1 tablespoon at a time. Whisk in lemon juice, salt, and cayenne. Use immediately or keep warm, covered, over double broiler over very low heat for up to 30 minutes.
